title: Triple J hosts Ben Harvey and Liam Stapleton's new breakfast radio job revealed
text:
Ben Harvey and Liam Stapleton have announced that they will record their final Triple J show in less than two weeks.

And on Tuesday, radio duo revealed they are changing networks and will now be hosting their breakfast show on Adelaide's Nova 91.9 FM.

Dylan Lewis and Hayley Pearson are the current hosts of the breakfast show.

Triple J hosts Ben Harvey (left) and Liam Stapleton (right)'s new breakfast radio job revealed as they jump ship to the Nova Network

Dylan announced he was in leaving in September, and Hayley annouced she was leaving shortly after.

'We can't wait to start the next phase of our careers back home in God's Country. Have they finished the road works on South Road yet?' Ben joked in a statement to the media.

His co-host Liam revealed they had an absolute blast at Triple J and still can't believe they were hired at the time.

Out! On Tuesday, radio duo revealed they are changing networks and will now be hosting their breakfast show on Adelaide's Nova 91.9 FM

He added: 'Don't know how Nova have hired us either, but hey we've signed now (suckers). We're really looking forward to coming home to Adelaide.'

On Monday morning, The Triple J hosts reflected on their three years hosting the show and said they would be 'forever grateful' for the opportunity.

'Never in our wildest dreams did we think two dweebs doing community radio in Adelaide would get a crack at a gig like this,' they said.

Talk! 'We can't wait to start the next phase of our careers back home in God's Country. Have they finished the road works on South Road yet?' Ben joked in a statement to the media

'Thanks for waking up with us, listening to our s**t talk and sharing your stories, we'll be forever grateful. The last three years are something we'll never forget.'

The replacement breakfast team has already been announced, with weekend afternoon hosts Sally Coleman and Erica Mallett taking over in 2020.

For the remainder of the year, Lucy Smith will be stepping as temporary host of Triple J Breakfast starting Monday, November 4.
